# mrangr

The **mrangr** package is designed to simulate metacommunities within a
**spatially explicit, mechanistic framework**. It extends the
functionality of the [`rangr`](https://github.com/ropensci/rangr)
package by allowing for the simulation of **multiple interacting
species** via an asymmetric interaction matrix.

This tool mimics the essential processes shaping metacommunity dynamics:
local population growth, dispersal, and interspecific interactions.
Simulations take place in dynamic environments, facilitating projections
of community shifts in response to environmental changes.

## Installation

You can install **mrangr** with:

``` r
install.packages("mrangr")
```

## Basic Workflow

The `mrangr` workflow involves initialising a community with spatial
data and interaction parameters, running the simulation, and analysing
the results.

### 1. Input Maps and Interactions

You must provide carrying capacity maps (`K_map`) and initial abundance
maps (`n1_map`) as `SpatRaster` objects. For a community of $N$ species,
the rasters must contain $N$ layers.

``` r
# Load example maps
K_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr"))
K_map <- subset(K_map, 1:2)
```

Interspecific interactions are defined using an **interaction matrix**
($a$), where values represent the per-capita interaction strength of the
species in the column on the species in the row.

``` r
# Example for 2 species with symmetric competition
nspec <- 2
a <- matrix(c(NA, -0.8, -0.8, NA), nrow = nspec, ncol = nspec)
```

### 2. Community Initialisation

Use
[`initialise_com()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/initialise_com.md)
to create a `sim_com_data` object. This stores all parameters, including
the intrinsic growth rate ($r$) and the dispersal rate.

``` r
first_com <- initialise_com(
  n1_map = round(K_map / 2), 
  K_map = K_map, 
  r = 1.1, 
  a = a, 
  rate = 1 / 500
)
```

### 3. Running the Simulation

The [`sim_com()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/sim_com.md)
function executes the simulation over a specified number of time steps.

``` r
first_sim <- sim_com(first_com, time = 100)
```

### 4. Visualisation

You can visualise the final spatial distributions or the change in mean
abundance over time.

``` r
# Visualise spatial niches at specific time steps
plot(first_sim, time = c(1, 10, 100))
```

![](reference/figures/README-vis-1.png)

``` r
# Plot abundance time series for all species
plot_series(first_sim)
```

![](reference/figures/README-vis-2.png)

## Virtual Ecologist

The package includes a
[`virtual_ecologist()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/virtual_ecologist.md)
function to simulate real-world observation processes. This allows users
to sample the simulated community at defined points in space and time,
incorporating sampling effort and detection probability into the
simulation.

## Citation

To cite **mrangr**, please use the
[`citation()`](https://rdrr.io/r/utils/citation.html) function:

``` r
library(mrangr)
citation("mrangr")
```

## Funding

This work was supported by the National Science Centre, Poland, grant
no. 2018/29/B/NZ8/00066 and the PoznaÅ„ Supercomputing and Networking
Centre (grant no. pl0090-01).

# Package index

## Simulation preparation

- [`grf()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/grf.md) :
  Generate a Gaussian Random Field

- [`K_sim()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/K_sim.md) :
  Carrying Capacity Map Simulator

- [`initialise_inv()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/initialise_inv.md)
  : Initialise Invasion Parameters

- [`initialise_com()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/initialise_com.md)
  : Initialise Community Simulation Data

- [`update(`*`<sim_com_data>`*`)`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/update.sim_com_data.md)
  :

  Update `sim_com_data` Object

- [`summary(`*`<sim_com_data>`*`)`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/summary.sim_com_data.md)
  :

  Summary Of `sim_com_data` Object

## Simulation

- [`sim_com()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/sim_com.md) :
  Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time

- [`summary(`*`<sim_com_results>`*`)`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/summary.sim_com_results.md)
  :

  Summary Of `sim_com_results` Object

## Results

- [`virtual_ecologist()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/virtual_ecologist.md)
  : Virtual Ecologist

- [`to_rast(`*`<sim_com_results>`*`)`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/to_rast.sim_com_results.md)
  :

  Convert `sim_com_results` to SpatRaster(s)

- [`plot(`*`<sim_com_results>`*`)`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/plot.sim_com_results.md)
  :

  Plot `sim_com_results` Object

- [`plot_series()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/plot_series.md)
  : Community Time-Series Plot

## Data

- [`K_map_eg.tif`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/K_map_eg.tif.md)
  : Example Of Carrying Capacity Map
- [`n1_map_eg.tif`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/n1_map_eg.tif.md)
  : Example Of Abundance Map At First Time Step Of The Simulation
- [`a_eg`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/a_eg.md) : Example
  Of Interaction Coefficients Matrix
- [`get_community()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/get_community.md)
  : Load Example Community Object
- [`community_eg`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/community_eg.md)
  : Example Community Data
- [`get_simulated_com()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/get_simulated_com.md)
  : Load Example Simulated Community Results
- [`simulated_com_eg`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/simulated_com_eg.md)
  : Example Simulated Community Output

## Helper functions

- [`diagonal()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/diagonal.md)
  : Compute Maximum Possible Distance for a Raster Object
- [`set_zero()`](https://popecol.github.io/mrangr/reference/set_zero.md)
  : Set Non-Missing Values to Zero
